title: Print, On the Beach at Long Branch-The Children's Hour, from Harper's Weekly, August 15, 1874, p. 672., 1874
title_raw: On the Beach at Long Branch-The Children's Hour, from Harper's Weekly, August 15, 1874, p. 672.
signed: Signed on block, lower left: J. L. LANGRIDGE Sc
inscribed: Caption: ON THE BEACH AT LONG BRANCH-THE CHILDREN'S HOUR.-(DRAWN BY WINSLOW HOMER.)
creditline: Gift of John Goldsmith Phillips, Jr.
description: Nurses and children on the beach.  In the left foreground, the toddler and infant's young mother appears to be saying goodbye to her children in order to join her "social set."  The children are being left under the supervision of the nanny and maid.  Information from Linda S. Ferber, Barbara Dayer Gallati and Marilyn S. Kushner, Winslow Homer: Illustrating America (New York, NY: George Braziller in association with the Brooklyn Museum of Art, 2000), p. 102.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, On the Beach at Long Branch-The Children's Hour, from Harper's Weekly, August 15, 1874, p. 672., 1874. Wood engraving on paper.. 
Gift of John Goldsmith Phillips, Jr.. 1947-4-22
